p: Virus isolates UK1-TuMV (Acc.N. AB194802), JPN1-TuMV (Acc.N. KM094174), Fny-CMV (Acc.N. NC_002034, NC_002035 and NC_001440, LS-CMV (Acc.N. AF416899, AF416900 and AF127976) and De72-CMV (not sequenced) were used. JPN1-TuMV was obtained from a field-infected plant of Raphanus sativus (Brassicaceae) [ 57] and De72-CMV from a field-infected plant of Diplotaxis erucoides (Brassicaceae) [ 58], and both were propagated in Nicotiana benthamiana plants. UK1-TuMV, Fny-CMV and LS-CMV were derived from biologically active clones [ 59, 60, 61] by in vitro transcription with T7 RNA polymerase (New England Biolabs, Ipswich, USA), and transcripts were used to infect N. benthamiana plants for virus multiplication.
